_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
2/8 2:40PM - Sure was a chilly one today! Although it was a cold and windy start to the day, sunshine and rising temperatures allowed for summit access by midday. Conditions continue to trend in the right direction, and were set to kick off the week with all 99 trails open for your Monday. Our grooming team will be up and out overnight laying fresh corduroy across 66 trails. For your way up, 9 lifts are scheduled to spin at 9AM, with the possibility of wind related delays. Temperatures tomorrow are looking a lot more comfortable with 14-18 degrees forecasted at the base and 5-9 degrees at the summit. It's still a good idea to stay bundled up as high winds will make temps feel colder than they actually are, especially in the early morning hours. 

With Presidents Week on the horizon, snowmaking is set to resume tomorrow afternoon as our team takes advantage of favorable temperatures to continue building and refreshing coverage across key areas of the mountain. There's plenty of fun to be had this upcoming holiday week and we couldn't be more stoked for whats in store! 

Ski ya in the morning!

Safety Tip: Skiing or riding in the trees? Always travel with a friend!

With conditions lining up this well, its a good time to take advantage of a few extra perks. Were offering lift tickets up to 50% off every Wednesday and Thursday this seasonexcluding Presidents Week. Plus, Ikon Pass and Stratton Season Pass holders can spread the love with a Friends and Family lift ticket discount of 50% off a regular-price lift ticket, available when purchased before February 13 and usable any day this season. 

Reliable cars are the name of the game; that is why we trust Oliver Subaru and Ford. Made for all seasons and all families, check out Oliver Ford and Oliver Subaru for year-round reliability!

Stay and relish the Green Mountains! Stratton Real Estate is here to help with all your real estate needs. Make your sweet escape a reality.

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Sunday, February 8, 6:02am -   Mostly sunny today with a high near 46 degrees and Southwest winds of 5-15mph with stronger guests along ridges. Firm conditions exist so ski with caution and allow more room for stopping and more distance from others. Use the daily grooming report and follow the sunshine for best conditions.  

  • Parking reservations are every weekend and holiday. Learn more about our Parking Program and Carpool Incentives.
  • For real time information at your fingertips, download the Ikon Pass App for updates on lift status, events, weather, and more.
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert: In an emergency, please contact: Palisades Dispatch 1 (530) 452-7145 | Alpine Dispatch 1 (530) 581-8222

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Today will have partly cloudy skies, with a high near 43. Winds are southwest at 6 to 10 mph.
CMH, Virtual Heli - Skiing Feb 6-8 - 9:00 AM 4:00 PM at Silver Lake Beach, 7600 Royal St, Park City, UT 84060.
_inspectorSnowReport.AdditionalText: CMH, Virtual Heli - Skiing Feb 6-8 - 9:00 AM  4:00 PM at Silver Lake Beach, 7600 Royal St, Park City, UT 84060.

_inspectorSnowReport.Report: Sunday February 8, 5:10 a.m.  Sunday will live up to its name today with plenty of solar rays coming your way. Temperatures will start the day just below freezing and rise to around 40 this afternoon under mostly sunny skies. Spring-like conditions continue, but not for long a significant pattern change is expected early next week with stormy skies and multiple hits of snow in the forecast.  Today, enjoy mild temperatures along with 70+ open trails, over 20 of which are groomed. The groomers have been skiing great but stay on the lookout for emerging geology due to recent warm weather. Check your speed, especially at breakovers which can hide unseen hazards. The Joy More Ikon Pass rewards challenge is in full effect, with 1000s of prizes ready for the taking. The more you scan your Ikon Pass, the more you can win. Goodies include quick waxes, trucker hats, hoodies, retail credit, dining and even Ikon Passes for next year!

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Sunday, February 8th, 2026 - Good Morning Skiers and Riders! This is Laurie with your snow report from 5am for Sunday, February 8th. Remember the easiest way to get up to date information is on the Ikon Pass app or website.  

Our Mid mountain base is 26 inches, the temperature is 29 degrees, the winds are calm, with clear skies. 

The Summit base is 35 inches, the temperature is 20 degrees, the winds are 15 miles per hour from the W, with partly cloudy skies. 

The base temperature is 24 degrees.  

We will be skiing and riding on 19 lifts, 163 runs, and 2818 acres on PP snow.  

Test your limits and push your endurance at Steamboat Resorts Ninety Pound Rucksack Challenge, a throwback event honoring the grit and legacy of the 10th Mountain Division. Strap in and sign up to carry the load yourself or come watch as athletes battle gravity and altitude. Get all the details at steamboat.com/events. 

Stay in the know with the Ikon Pass App. Find it in the app store on your mobile device and get lift and trail statuses, conditions updates, and more.  

If you are thinking of exploring outside the ski area boundaries, and dont know exactly where you are going, dont go.  

Ski and Ride with Care and we will see you on the mountain!

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Sunday, February 8, 2026 6:30 AM Icon Pass Early Ups this morning at 7:30 AM, followed by a complimentary hot breakfast at McCoy Station from 8:009:30 AM, or while supplies last. 7 lifts are expected to spin at 7:30 AM (see below for the full list), with 24 lifts scheduled to open at 8:30 AM, conditions permitting. Its another mostly sunny day on the hill, with moderate winds blowing in Tuesday's storm system. Expect gusts to pick up in the afternoon. Cruise down Havent the Foggiest for long, easygoing turns.  
 
Conditions and Visibility: Mostly sunny skies, building SW winds, and temps into the 30s and 40s. Morning laps will be on the firmer side, with a more relaxed feel developing as temperatures climb. 
Lift status: 24 lifts are on the schedule to operate today, conditions permitting. Expected 7:30AM lifts are Broadway Express (1), Stump Alley Express (2), Facelift Express (3), Eagle Express (15), Canyon Express (16), the Village Gondola, and Lower Panorama Gondola. 
Events: Icon Pass Early Ups presented by AG1 at 7:30AM, followed by a complimentary hot breakfast at McCoy Station from 8:00-9:30 AM or while supplies last. 
Safety: Find Terrain That Suits Your Ability - Accidents can occur when skiers and riders find themselves on terrain out of their ability level. Before you head down the mountain, plan out your route using a trail map or the Ikon App. Visit our Safety page for more tips. Our on-mountain emergency hotline is: 760.934.0611
Road Conditions: Roads are mostly clear, but slick spots may exist in the shade. Drive with caution. Check our Road Conditions page for the latest status.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: Find Terrain That Suits Your Ability - Accidents can occur when skiers and riders find themselves on terrain out of their ability level. Before you head down the mountain, plan out your route using a trail map or the Ikon App. Emergency Hotline: 760.934.0611

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Friday, February 7, 2026 -- 7:45AM
Sun is shining, slopes are sliding, and we are riding. Snow is prime this morning, cold temps overnight kept the snow in shape and ready to rip. Do your snow dances because we are looking at a chance the forecast might change in the upcoming week. Bucky's Bonfire today at 1:30, come for some jams and share a hot chocolate with Bucky and his friends! 
All food locations are open!

2/8/26 2:00 PM Update: It's a sleepy Sunday afternoon with all the hype in the city! Conditions are shaping up nicely with a couple inches of new snow from overnight and cooler temps holding it together. Expect soft turns where the fresh snow has settled, with some firm and icy spots still mixed in across the mountain, especially in higher-traffic areas. Keep your edges sharp and ski with awareness.

Don't forget to check out Rafters to catch the Super Bowl live at 3:30pm, with food and drink specials for the big game. The last time the Seahawks won the Super Bowl, the snow started dumping, so were rooting a little extra hard this season. Enjoy the new snow and the game.


Note: The Mt. Rainier Gondola is available for downloading! With variable conditions through Lucky Shot, dont force it if you're second guessing the terrain. Take the scenic ride down and keep it smooth out there.


Campbell Basin Lodge will be closed today 2/8 for maintenance. 

Notes for today:
  1. Campbell Basin Lodge will be closed today 2/8 for maintenance. 
  2. The Summit House will be closed all day on the 12th, 13th and 19th of February.
  3. Night Skiing hours have been adjusted to 4pm to 7pm. Night Skiing has been cancelled for the following dates: 2/16, 2/17, and 2/18. 
  4. Weve made the decision to discontinue the parking waitlist for the 25/26 season. Parking reservations are back to first-come, first-served basis, and still required on weekends and holidays
  5. Book your shuttle today! The Crystal Express Shuttle is free with a reservation, and runs on weekends and holidays, with multiple departures from the Enumclaw Expo Center Parking Lot. 
  6. $62 Day tickets continue every Tuesday for the remainder of the season!
  7. Did you know it just takes 5 Days to be entered to win a 26/27 Ikon Pass? Track your days on the Ikon App and register for RIDE TO WIN
  8. Looking to save time and make the most of the day? Consider grabbing a Daily Reserve Upgrade! Offered on weekends and holidays, this upgrade grants access to priority lift lines, getting you on the lift quicker and more laps faster. 
  9. Paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. While you may not receive an immediate reply, the cancellation will be processed. The Crystal Mountain Contact center cannot process these cancellations.
  10. In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911

Mountain Weather 2/8/2026 4:00pm 

Forecaster: Bradford Swanson

Synopsis: Sunday's storm came in a little on the weak side, with only about an inch of snow falling during the day. The upper-atmosphere jet stream is a little broken and disjointed right now, resulting in one more day of sporadic snowfall. Monday will remain mostly cloudy with an occasional sprinkle of snow for ambiance. Expect light winds and cool temps as we enjoy some Northwest flow for a change. Monday night, the trickle will turn off as the clouds and precipitation dissipate by morning. This might not have been the most powerful storm in the world, but it's been nice to have a taste of winter return to Crystal.

Sunday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 4,000
12hr Precip: Trace-2 possible
Wind Trends: Light West Southwest
Monday: 
Sky Cover: Mostly Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 3,500
12hr Precip: Trace amounts of snow possible
Wind Trends: Light West Southwest
Monday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 3,500
12hr Precip: None
Wind Trends: Light South Southeast

Outlook: Tuesday and Wednesday will be mostly clear with light winds and lots of sunshine. This is due to a low-pressure system over Oregon that is stalling out, resulting in stagnant weather over Washington. The good news is that temps are expected to remain reasonably cool, so Crystal should not lose too much snow during the upcoming dry period. 


Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card, this must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, bottom of Chinook, bottom of Discovery, and top of Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS,CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find your right fit.
  • Freeride Program (NEW! Adult Programs now available): Registration now open, limited spots available! 
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on mountain storage with limited availability, lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or the entire family, check out options today .
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!  Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
February 8th, 1:19 PM
*Northridge will be delayed to start Monday*
Good afternoon skiers and riders! Its a freezer out there today, but perfect for a few frosty laps before you thaw out and tune in to the big game this afternoon. Tomorrows forecast calls for partly cloudy skies with strong morning winds that may affect lift operations. Temps will rise tomorrow but will still be cold. We're looking at low single digits at the summit and mid-to-low teens at the base. Bundle up because temps will feel colder due to wind chill. Tomorrow well be getting down on 484 skiable acres, served by 13 lifts, with 57 of 111 trails groomed, including fan favorites like Ripcord, Birch Run, and Elbow. Look forward to top-tier groomers, along with wind-blown packed powder across the mountain.

Operations will return to regular weekday hours. GMX will get the party started, loading at 8:00 AM. All other scheduled lifts open at 9:00 AM. Slide Brook is scheduled to spin tomorrow but may be affected by cold temps. Make your way to the Gate House terrain for some sun-soaked groomers and a welcome break from the wind. The legendary Sugarbush Parks crew has you covered for all your freestyle fun.  At Mt. Ellen, youll find over 94 features on Riemergasse and another 28 on Sugar Run, all serviced by the iconic Sunny Quad. At Lincoln Peak, Slowpoke now has 18 refreshed features, and 7 playful features remain in Sugarbear Forest. Inverness will be closed to the public for racing events tomorrow and will reopen to the public once events are finished.

Join us this afternoon at Rumbles Bistro & Bar for the BIG Game and experience football like never before! Were showing all the action on our massive TV wall, so you wont miss a single play. Kickoff is at 6:30 PM, so get here early to grab your seat and settle in for the excitement. Join us Feb. 12th at Rumbles Bistro & Bar for the Olympic Halfpipe Finals! Were showing all the action on our massive TV wall, so you wont miss it. Our friends at POW will be here to host the watch party and support POW athletes Chloe Kim and Bea Kim. Things get started at 1:30PM, so get here early to grab your seat and get ready to cheer on Team USA! Check out all our winter events.

All Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen uphill routes are currently open. Please review our Uphill Travel Policy for full details.

Sunday February 8th 2026 | 5:32

Bonjour Tremblant!

Good morning! Our sunday is starting off very cold on the mountain, with milder temperatures expected around 10:00 a.m. Additionally, it will once again be a windy day, especially across the summit, so bundling up is essential. Cover exposed skin, take warm-up breaks when needed, and stay aware to keep frostbite off your agenda.

Moreover, in response to the cold early-morning forecast, operations will be adjusted today. Duncan and Soleil lifts will open gradually as conditions allow. For First Tracks, head to the Tlcabine Express on the South Side, while on the North Side, early laps will be available via Expo and Lowell Thomas. The Casino Express will also be spinning at 7:30 a.m., keeping the Versant Soleil open.

Its truly one of those full-on winter mornings; cold, windy, but totally worth it! Layer up like a pro, keep the face covered, chase those first tracks, and warm up later when the sun and softer temps roll in. The snows here... see you at the summit!

Mountain safety tip of the week:  Slow down in reduced-speed zones.
These zones require lower speeds for your safety and the safety of others.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:

Here is some information about the operations on Monday, February 9th 2026.

_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: Happy Sunday eveyrone! Due to the cold temperatures expected early this morning, operations will be adjusted today. The Duncan and Soleil lifts will open gradually as conditions allow. First Tracks will be available via the Tlcabine Express (South Side) as well as Expo and Lowell Thomas (North Side). The Casino Express will be operating as of 7:30 a.m., keeping the Versant Soleil open.

Les remontes Duncan et Soleil ouvriront progressivement selon les conditions. Les Premires Traces seront accessibles via la Tlcabine Express (versant Sud) ainsi que par Expo et Lowell Thomas (versant Nord). La remonte Casino Express sera en opration ds 7 h 30, permettant de maintenir le Versant Soleil ouvert.

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Updated: Feb 6, 2026

"Champagne" powder in Ontario? Yes, you read that right! With the Georgian Bay frozen over, we're getting rare Western interior powder instead of our usual lake effect snow.

Our Ops Team breaks down why this snow feels so different, and also includes an insider view into how we renovate our trails. Get the full scoop in our Operations Update on the blog.

Watch  Renovating Snow 101 at Blue Mountain
